result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Lee Dohrwardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The costs are due as follows:  $221.50 due October 24, 2015 and $221.50 due November 24, 2015.

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Michael Lee Dohrwardt in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into record.  Plea of no contest to count 2.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists. Court dismisses and read in Count 1.   Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2 and orders court costs  and DNA surcharge.  The costs are to be paid $221.50 due October 24, 2015 and $221.50 due November 24, 2015.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Michael Lee Dohrwardt in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.  - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
for Initial Appearance on 6-2-2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in court, in custody with Attorney Karl Kelz.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $500.00 signature bond; booking and no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court orders a $500.00 signature bond; booking and no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Next court date is June 2, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
